characters.name: David
characters.biography: David was the second king of Israel, a man after God's own heart. He was a shepherd, warrior, musician, and poet who wrote many of the Psalms.
characters.significance: David's life demonstrates God's grace, the importance of repentance, and the promise of the Messiah through his lineage.

timeline.significance: Chosen by God to be the next king.
A defining moment of faith and courage.

characters.name: Jesus
characters.biography: Jesus Christ is the Son of God, the Messiah promised in the Old Testament. He lived a sinless life, died on the cross for our sins, and rose again on the third day.
characters.significance: Jesus is the central figure of Christianity, the Savior of the world, and the only way to salvation.

characters.name: Jonathan
characters.biography: Jonathan was the eldest son of King Saul and the best friend of David. He is known for his loyalty, courage, and selfless devotion to God's chosen king.
characters.significance: Jonathan's relationship with David is the biblical model for loyal friendship and putting God's will above personal ambition.

timeline.significance: A bond of loyalty more than brothers.

characters.name: Nicodemus
characters.biography: Nicodemus was a Pharisee and a ruler of the Jews who came to Jesus by night to ask about His teachings. Jesus told him that a man must be born again to see the kingdom of God. Though initially confused, Nicodemus later defended Jesus before the Sanhedrin (John 7:50-51) and helped prepare His body for burial with costly spices (John 19:39-40), showing a growing faith that moved from secrecy to open devotion.
characters.significance: Nicodemus represents the sincere seeker who moves from intellectual curiosity to genuine faith. His conversation with Jesus produced the most famous verse in the Bible — John 3:16 — and introduced the essential doctrine of being born again.
characters.occupation: Pharisee, Ruler of the Jews, Member of the Sanhedrin

timeline.significance: Learned about the new birth and God's love for the world (John 3:16).
Spoke up for fairness, asking that Jesus be heard before being judged.

timeline.event: Helped Prepare Jesus' Body for Burial
timeline.significance: Brought 75 pounds of myrrh and aloes — an act of open devotion and great cost.

characters.name: John the Apostle
characters.biography: John was the son of Zebedee and the brother of James. He was one of the first disciples called by Jesus and became part of the inner circle along with Peter and James. Known as 'the disciple whom Jesus loved,' John was present at the Transfiguration, in Gethsemane, and at the foot of the cross where Jesus entrusted His mother Mary to John's care. He authored the Gospel of John, the epistles of 1-3 John, and the book of Revelation while in exile on the island of Patmos.
characters.significance: John's writings emphasize the deity of Christ, the centrality of love, and the promise of eternal life. His Gospel contains the most beloved verse in Scripture (John 3:16) and provides the deepest theological portrait of Jesus as the eternal Word made flesh.

timeline.significance: Left his fishing nets and father Zebedee to follow Jesus immediately.
Jesus entrusted His mother Mary to John's care — a sign of deep trust.
Written so that readers might believe Jesus is the Christ and have life through His name.

timeline.event: Exile on Patmos and Wrote Revelation
timeline.significance: Received visions of the end times and the triumph of Christ.
